trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of constraints for a <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref>.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection> is accessed through the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.Constraints%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection> can contain both <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> and <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> objects for the <xref:System.Data.DataTable>.
A <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> object makes sure that data in a specific column is always unique to preserve the data integrity.
The <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> determines what will occur in related tables when data in the <xref:System.Data.DataTable> is either updated or deleted.
For example, if a row is deleted, the <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> will determine whether the related rows are also deleted (a cascade), or some other course of action.

When you add a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> that creates a relationship between two tables to a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, both a <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> and a <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> are created automatically.

The <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> is applied to the primary key column in the parent <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, and the constraint is added to that table's <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection>.
The <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> is applied to the primary key column and the foreign key column, and the constraint is added to the child table's <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection>.

The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection> uses standard collection methods such as <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Clear%2A>, and <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Remove%2A>.
In addition, the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method can be used to look for the existence of a particular constraint in the collection.

A <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> is created when a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> with its <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property set to `true` is added to a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object's <xref:System.Data.DataColumnCollection>.
A <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> is created when a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> is added to a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> object's <xref:System.Data.DataRelationCollection>.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> object to the collection.
If the collection is successfully changed by adding or removing constraints, the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs.
The `Constraint` to add.
The constraint argument is null.
The constraint already belongs to this collection, or belongs to another collection.
The collection already has a constraint with the same name.
(The comparison is not case-sensitive.)

Constructs a new <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> with the specified name, <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>, and value that indicates whether the column is a primary key, and adds it to the collection.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is added successfully.
The name of the `UniqueConstraint`.
The <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> to which the constraint applies.
Specifies whether the column should be the primary key.
If `true`, the column will be a primary key column.
A new `UniqueConstraint`.
The constraint already belongs to this collection.
-Or-
The constraint belongs to another collection.
The collection already has a constraint with the specified name.
(The comparison is not case-sensitive.)
Constructs a new <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> with the specified name, parent column, and child column, and adds the constraint to the collection.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is added successfully.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref>.
The primary key, or parent, <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>.
The foreign key, or child, <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref>.
A new `ForeignKeyConstraint`.

Constructs a new <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref> with the specified name, array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects, and value that indicates whether the column is a primary key, and adds it to the collection.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is added successfully.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.UniqueConstraint"></xref>.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects to which the constraint applies.
Specifies whether the column should be the primary key.
If `true`, the column will be a primary key column.
A new `UniqueConstraint`.
The constraint already belongs to this collection.
-Or-
The constraint belongs to another collection.
The collection already has a constraint with the specified name.
(The comparison is not case-sensitive.)
Constructs a new <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref>, with the specified arrays of parent columns and child columns, and adds the constraint to the collection.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is added successfully.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref>.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects that are the primary key, or parent, columns.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects that are the foreign key, or child, columns.
A new `ForeignKeyConstraint`.
Copies the elements of the specified <xref href="System.Data.ConstraintCollection"></xref> array to the end of the collection.
If <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit%2A> has been called, `AddRange` does not add any objects to the collection until <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit%2A> is called.
At the time that `EndInit` is called, the collection will be populated with the items specified in the most recent call to `AddRange`.
If `AddRange` is called multiple times within a `BeginInit` / `EndInit` sequence, only those items specified in the most recent call to `AddRange` are added.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.ConstraintCollection"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
Indicates whether a <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> can be removed.

The default behavior whenever a <xref:System.Data.DataRelation> is added to a <xref:System.Data.DataSet>, is to add a <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> to the parent table and a <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> to the child table.

The <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> is applied to the primary key column of the parent table, and the <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> is applied to the foreign key column of the child table.

Because trying to remove the <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> before removing the <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint> causes an exception to be thrown, you should always use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CanRemove%2A> method before calling Remove, to make sure that the <xref:System.Data.UniqueConstraint> can be removed.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> to be tested for removal from the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> can be removed from collection; otherwise, `false`.
Clears the collection of any <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> objects.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if this action is successful.
Occurs whenever the <xref href="System.Data.ConstraintCollection"></xref> is changed because of <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> objects being added or removed.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Indicates whether the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> object specified by name exists in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether the specified <xref:System.Data.Constraint> exists before trying to remove it from the collection.
You can also use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CanRemove%2A> method to determine whether a <xref:System.Data.Constraint> can be removed.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint.ConstraintName"></xref> of the constraint.
`true` if the collection contains the specified constraint; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the collection objects to a one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> instance starting at the specified index.
The one-dimensional <xref href="System.Array"></xref> that is the destination of the values copied from the collection.
The index of the array at which to start inserting.
Gets the index of the specified <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref>.

Use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to return an index to be used with either the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> or <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> to search for.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> if it is in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Gets the index of the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> specified by name.

Use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to return an index to be used with either the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> or <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Remove%2A> method.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref>.
The index of the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> if it is in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> from the collection at the specified index.
Use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method to test for the existence of a specific constraint.
The index of the constraint to return.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> at the specified index.
The index value is greater than the number of items in the collection.
Gets the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> from the collection with the specified name.
Use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method to test for the existence of a specific constraint.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint.ConstraintName"></xref> of the constraint to return.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> with the specified name; otherwise a null value if the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> does not exist.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> from the collection.

Before using the `Remove` method, you can use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether the collection contains the target <xref:System.Data.Constraint>, and the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CanRemove%2A> method to determine whether a <xref:System.Data.Constraint> can be removed.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is successfully removed.
The <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> to remove.
The constraint argument is `null`.
The constraint does not belong to the collection.
Removes the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> object specified by name from the collection.

Before using the `Remove` method, you can use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether the collection contains the target <xref:System.Data.Constraint>, and the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CanRemove%2A> method to determine whether a <xref:System.Data.Constraint> can be removed.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is successfully removed.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> to remove.
Removes the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> object at the specified index from the collection.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns the index of a specific <xref:System.Data.Constraint>.

Before using the `RemoveAt` method, you can use the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether the collection contains the target <xref:System.Data.Constraint>, and the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CanRemove%2A> method to determine whether a <xref:System.Data.Constraint> can be removed.
The <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.CollectionChanged> event occurs if the constraint is successfully removed.
The index of the <xref href="System.Data.Constraint"></xref> to remove.
The collection does not have a constraint at this index.
